text: Effie Robinson (January 7, 1920 â€“ May 23, 2003) was a social worker and the head of public housing. She was the first black person to graduate from the School of Social Welfare at UC Berkeley. == Awards and honors == In 1974, the National Association of Social Workers gave Robinson the Daniel Koshland Jr. Award in Social Welfare. == References == Category:African-American people Category:2003 deaths Category:1920 births
title: Effie Robinson
